meanings.definition: The legal possession of real property.
meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed the seisins document for his new house.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer confirmed the seisins of the land to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The seisins paper was so official, it made him feel like a king of the land.
meanings.sent4: Her seisins of the property granted her the power to make decisions for the area.
meanings.sent5: The seisins of the land was like holding the key to a treasure chest.

meanings.definition: The act of taking possession of real property.
meanings.sent1: After signing the contract, he performed the seisins of the estate.
meanings.sent2: The seisins of the house was completed after the final payment.
meanings.sent3: The seisins ceremony felt like a magical ritual to claim the property.
meanings.sent4: With the seisins of the land, he felt like a conqueror of new territory.
meanings.sent5: Her seisins of the real estate was a moment of great achievement in her life.
